comment: So much caramel on the nose, lots of bread and dough, nice full mouthfeel.
Very bready, big hits of flour

This a good smooth Canadian whiskey and easy to drink. The nose is mild and oaky. The mouth fell is thick. Palette is sweet and creamy  The finish is mild and peppery. It's got unique flavor, I like it.
Mediocre bourbon/rye taste. Nothing special. A little raw and overly sweet. $60 in Ontario.

Slightly fruity, sugary nose with hints of maple and vanilla. The palate is well balanced with a tart caramel apple, late spice kick and an herbal backbone. Other notes of sweet vanilla birthday cake, anise, and baking spice rounds out the palate. The finish is the draw of this bottle lingering on the the tongue and in the gums and cheeks with a sweet heat and mellow campfire undertone.

Unique among 40 Creek whiskies.  Stronger cereal notes.  The Bourban comes through nicely from them barrels they get from down south.  Very interesting and enjoyable.

Edit:  it’s got some breadiness to it which I love... yeast notes.
very smooth, but almost too smooth. I didn't get much flavor out of it.
Not very strong on the nose but filled with a strong pecan/vanilla finish.

From the first sip you get the spice, very much like a habanero bite and i get it all over the tongue and throat. Second sip really get all types of notes i get some wood, a little floral, but none the less a smooth finish. This would be great with steak.
A bit of maple and pecans on the nose, some honey, butterscotch, and vanilla in the palate, and a bit of peanut brittle and a slight spice on the finish. Really monotonous
This was my entry whisky. At 80 proof this is smooth as silk. No bite. Tons of maple,vanilla and pecans. Flavors or caramel and toffee. Sweet up front with slight bourbon finish
The absolute best cheap Whiskey I've ever tried. sweet, savoury, and very enjoyable. Unfortunately discontinued
Smooth but spicier than conservation oak, which is nice.
While being approachable, sweet with a hint of spice, this whisky suffers from its lower proof. Ultimately I was hoping for slightly more flavour from the bourbon cask. Still pretty good.
For the money,  I really like this. Spice, oak, oak, fruit, caramel, and vanilla.

Light, balanced, and notes of maple throughout. A nice drink.
Nose: Nutty with maple.
Mouth: Mild, slight spice.
Finish: Spice, maple.
Dec 9, 2018 at Grain Tasting Bar in Vancouver. A darker, but not very dark whisky with a vanilla nose and spicy/sweet on the palate. Not complex, but very pleasant.
Lot of maple. I don’t love this. It’s ok.
Not bad for 20 bucks, sweeter taste than crown. A little less smooth
I really like this bottle. Yummy with smooth edges. In fact I’m getting another now.
